result.execSummary:
The defendant Yukio I. Will was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Yukio I. Will is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Yukio I. Will was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
No violent contact w/ Natasha Beskow-Viverito unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  If not living w/ mother of child, deft to pay child support.  Comply w/ sex offender registry.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John Caviale.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  Credit for 2 days served if probation is revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Yukio I. Will, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on December 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Yukio I. Will, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
Atty Caviale states he is no longer looking to withdraw; however, case is not resolved at this time.  This case will trail 15CF259.  STC on 11/5/15 at 10:10AM, 1/7/16 at 1:00 PM and 1/11/16 at 8:30 AM.
in Support of Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Caviale
filed by Atty Caviale
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Drees

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney John Louis Caviale appeared.  Clerk: PT
No appearance by the Defendant.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $3000 Cash Bond, but will stay it until Monday at which time bond will be forfeited if no voluntary appearance is requested.  

11:00 AM -  DE is now present in court.  Atty Cavaile states DE was confused with the date and was home with his sick kids.  Court vacates bench warrant and Atty Caviale requests a pre-trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
*No Violent Contact w/ Natasha J B-V or her residence and no discussion of this case.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Yukio I. Will, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.   Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on DE's motion to modify bond conditions.  Upon hearing arguments motion is granted and DE shall have no violent contact with Natasha J B-V or her residence and no discussion of this case.
To Clerk in regards to hearing
to Modify Bond filed by Atty Caviale
Final pre-trial on September 3, 2015 at 09:40 am confirmed with Atty Caviale
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 9/3/15 at 9:40 AM
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John Caviale. Clerk LE.   Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-30-15 @ 8:30am with 15CF259. Atty. Caviale withdraws bond motion. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
to Modify Bond filed by Atty. Caviale

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 6-26-15 @ 8:30.  $5000 signature bond set with conditions.

*No Contact w/ Natasha J B-V or her residence
